location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 169: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: This letter concerns a vessel belonging to Sheik Houssein, Chief of Congoon [KangƒÅn], which was recently seized and plundered by a number of boats belonging to Sheik Yoosoof ben Moobaruck ben Ally of Nabend. Samuel Hennell states that Sheik Houssein has asked Hennell either to respond to the act of piracy or to allow Sheik Houssein to do so himself. Hennell asks for instructions from Justin Sheil.
